<a id="SystemFont"></a>

# SystemFont

**Inherits:** [Font](Font.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A font loaded from a system font. Falls back to a default theme font if not implemented on the host OS.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

**SystemFont** loads a font from a system font with the first matching name from [font_names](SystemFont.md#SystemFont_property_font_names).

It will attempt to match font style, but it's not guaranteed.

The returned font might be part of a font collection or be a variable font with OpenType "weight", "width" and/or "italic" features set.

You can create [FontVariation](FontVariation.md) of the system font for precise control over its features.

\ **Note:** This class is implemented on iOS, Linux, macOS and Windows, on other platforms it will fallback to default theme font.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="SystemFont_property_allow_system_fallback"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **allow_system_fallback** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#SystemFont_property_allow_system_fallback)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_allow_system_fallback**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_allow_system_fallback**\ (\ )

If set to ``true``, system fonts can be automatically used as fallbacks.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SystemFont_property_antialiasing"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[FontAntialiasing](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FontAntialiasing) **antialiasing** = `1` [ðŸ”—](#SystemFont_property_antialiasing)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_antialiasing**\ (\ value\: [FontAntialiasing](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FontAntialiasing)\ )
- [FontAntialiasing](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FontAntialiasing) **get_antialiasing**\ (\ )

Font anti-aliasing mode.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SystemFont_property_disable_embedded_bitmaps"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **disable_embedded_bitmaps** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#SystemFont_property_disable_embedded_bitmaps)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_disable_embedded_bitmaps**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **get_disable_embedded_bitmaps**\ (\ )

If set to ``true``, embedded font bitmap loading is disabled (bitmap-only and color fonts ignore this property).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SystemFont_property_font_italic"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **font_italic** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#SystemFont_property_font_italic)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_font_italic**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **get_font_italic**\ (\ )

If set to ``true``, italic or oblique font is preferred.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SystemFont_property_font_names"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[PackedStringArray](PackedStringArray.md) **font_names** = `PackedStringArray()` [ðŸ”—](#SystemFont_property_font_names)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_font_names**\ (\ value\: [PackedStringArray](PackedStringArray.md)\ )
- [PackedStringArray](PackedStringArray.md) **get_font_names**\ (\ )

Array of font family names to search, first matching font found is used.

**Note:** The returned array is *copied* and any changes to it will not update the original property value. See [PackedStringArray](PackedStringArray.md) for more details.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SystemFont_property_font_stretch"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **font_stretch** = `100` [ðŸ”—](#SystemFont_property_font_stretch)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_font_stretch**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_font_stretch**\ (\ )

Preferred font stretch amount, compared to a normal width. A percentage value between ``50%`` and ``200%``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SystemFont_property_font_weight"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **font_weight** = `400` [ðŸ”—](#SystemFont_property_font_weight)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_font_weight**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_font_weight**\ (\ )

Preferred weight (boldness) of the font. A value in the ``100...999`` range, normal font weight is ``400``, bold font weight is ``700``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SystemFont_property_force_autohinter"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **force_autohinter** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#SystemFont_property_force_autohinter)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_force_autohinter**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_force_autohinter**\ (\ )

If set to ``true``, auto-hinting is supported and preferred over font built-in hinting.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SystemFont_property_generate_mipmaps"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **generate_mipmaps** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#SystemFont_property_generate_mipmaps)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_generate_mipmaps**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **get_generate_mipmaps**\ (\ )

If set to ``true``, generate mipmaps for the font textures.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SystemFont_property_hinting"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Hinting](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Hinting) **hinting** = `1` [ðŸ”—](#SystemFont_property_hinting)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_hinting**\ (\ value\: [Hinting](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Hinting)\ )
- [Hinting](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Hinting) **get_hinting**\ (\ )

Font hinting mode.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SystemFont_property_keep_rounding_remainders"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **keep_rounding_remainders** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#SystemFont_property_keep_rounding_remainders)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_keep_rounding_remainders**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **get_keep_rounding_remainders**\ (\ )

If set to ``true``, when aligning glyphs to the pixel boundaries rounding remainders are accumulated to ensure more uniform glyph distribution. This setting has no effect if subpixel positioning is enabled.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SystemFont_property_modulate_color_glyphs"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **modulate_color_glyphs** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#SystemFont_property_modulate_color_glyphs)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_modulate_color_glyphs**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_modulate_color_glyphs**\ (\ )

If set to ``true``, color modulation is applied when drawing colored glyphs, otherwise it's applied to the monochrome glyphs only.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SystemFont_property_msdf_pixel_range"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **msdf_pixel_range** = `16` [ðŸ”—](#SystemFont_property_msdf_pixel_range)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_msdf_pixel_range**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_msdf_pixel_range**\ (\ )

The width of the range around the shape between the minimum and maximum representable signed distance. If using font outlines, [msdf_pixel_range](SystemFont.md#SystemFont_property_msdf_pixel_range) must be set to at least *twice* the size of the largest font outline. The default [msdf_pixel_range](SystemFont.md#SystemFont_property_msdf_pixel_range) value of ``16`` allows outline sizes up to ``8`` to look correct.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SystemFont_property_msdf_size"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **msdf_size** = `48` [ðŸ”—](#SystemFont_property_msdf_size)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_msdf_size**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_msdf_size**\ (\ )

Source font size used to generate MSDF textures. Higher values allow for more precision, but are slower to render and require more memory. Only increase this value if you notice a visible lack of precision in glyph rendering.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SystemFont_property_multichannel_signed_distance_field"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **multichannel_signed_distance_field** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#SystemFont_property_multichannel_signed_distance_field)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_multichannel_signed_distance_field**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_multichannel_signed_distance_field**\ (\ )

If set to ``true``, glyphs of all sizes are rendered using single multichannel signed distance field generated from the dynamic font vector data.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SystemFont_property_oversampling"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **oversampling** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#SystemFont_property_oversampling)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_oversampling**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_oversampling**\ (\ )

If set to a positive value, overrides the oversampling factor of the viewport this font is used in. See [Viewport.oversampling](Viewport.md#Viewport_property_oversampling). This value doesn't override the ``oversampling`` parameter of ``draw_*`` methods.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SystemFont_property_subpixel_positioning"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[SubpixelPositioning](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_SubpixelPositioning) **subpixel_positioning** = `1` [ðŸ”—](#SystemFont_property_subpixel_positioning)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_subpixel_positioning**\ (\ value\: [SubpixelPositioning](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_SubpixelPositioning)\ )
- [SubpixelPositioning](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_SubpixelPositioning) **get_subpixel_positioning**\ (\ )

Font glyph subpixel positioning mode. Subpixel positioning provides shaper text and better kerning for smaller font sizes, at the cost of memory usage and font rasterization speed. Use [TextServer.SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_AUTO](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_AUTO) to automatically enable it based on the font size.
